column1: Cognitive Behavioural Psychotherapy: Adult or Children and Young people (MSc)
column3: College of Health, Psychology and Social Care
column5: Our aim is to help you to become a skilled, independent cognitive behavioural psychotherapist. If you’re a caring professional who would like to develop expertise in evidence-based psychotherapy, CBT is for you.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 2 years full time, 3 years part time
